article:
'Jennifer Morla' (born 1955 in Manhattan, New York, USA) is an American graphic
designer and artist based San Francisco, California.

Jennifer Morla studied conceptual art at Hartford Art School, University of
Hartford and received her BFA in Graphic Design from Massachusetts College of
Art in Boston, Massachusetts. She is President and Creative Director of
[http://www.morladesign.com Morla Design] San Francisco (1984âpresent), was
Chief Creative Officer of client Design Within Reach (2006â2008), and is an
adjunct professor at [http://www.cca.edu/academics/faculty/jmorla California
College of the Arts] [http://www.cca.edu/academics/faculty/jmorla Jennifer
Morla, California College of the Arts Design Faculty]' (1992âpresent).
Prior to opening Morla Design, she was the Art Director at Levi Strauss & Co.
and Senior Designer at PBS Television, San Francisco.

She was a 2012 invited artist at [http://theworkshopresidence.com/residents/jennifer-
morla The Workshop Residence], [http://theworkshopresidence.com/residents/jennifer-
morla Jennifer Morla at The Workshop Residence] where she investigated
typographic forms as applied to felt floor coverings and wall panels. In 2010,
[http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/medalist-jennifermorla Jennifer Morla was
awarded the graphic design industry's highest award of recognition] [http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/medalist-
jennifermorla Jennifer Morla awarded AIGA Medal 2010]
[http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/medalists the AIGA Medal]. In 2008, under her
creative and marketing direction, Design Within Reach was awarded the AIGA
Corporate Leadership Award [http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/corporate-leadership-
award The AIGA Corporate Leadership Award] for the successful interaction
between aesthetics and business pragmatics.

Jennifer Morla's work has been published extensively, including multiple pieces
in Meggs' History of Graphic Design, (5th Edition) and The Poster: 1000 Posters
from Toulouse-Lautrec to Sagmeister. She has been featured in numerous national
and international magazines such as [[The New York Times Magazine]],
[http://www.graphis.com/archive/magazines/?p=160
Graphis], [http://www.graphis.com/archive/magazines/?p=160 Graphis, Issue
319, Jennifer Morla: Any Way, Shape, or Form, p 22]
[http://www.commarts.com/Search.aspx?code=morla&c=True&ft=False&dt=i
Communication
Arts], [http://www.commarts.com/Search.aspx?code=morla&c=True&ft=False&dt=i
Jennifer Morla in Communication Arts Magazine] IDEA(Japan), Linea Graphica
(Italy), A DiseÃ±o (Mexico) and Novum (Germany).

Her work is part of the permanent collections of the [http://www.moma.org/colle-
ction/browse_results.php?criteria=O%3AAD%3AE%3A7518&page_number=&template_id=6&-
sort_order=1 Museum of Modern Art] [http://www.moma.org/collection/browse_-
results.php?criteria=O%3AAD%3AE%3A7518&page_number=&template_id=6&sort_order=1
Jennifer Morla at Museum of Modern Art] (2 acquisitions), the
[http://www.sfmoma.org/artists/2834?artwork=27245 San Francisco Museum of Modern
Art] [http://www.sfmoma.org/artists/2834?artwork=27245 Jennifer Morla at
SFMoMA] (50 graphic design acquisitions and 1 new media acquisition), the
[http://americanart.si.edu/collections/search/artist/?id=7381 Smithsonian
American Art Museum]
[http://americanart.si.edu/collections/search/artist/?id=7381 Jennifer
Morla at Smithsonian American Art Museum] (1 acquisition), the Denver Art
Museum (8 acquisitions) and the [http://www.loc.gov/pictures/item/iuc2009005443
Library of Congress] [http://www.loc.gov/pictures/item/iuc2009005443
Jennifer Morla at Library of Congress] (1 acquisition).

Jennifer Morla has also had solo exhibitions at the [http://www.artfacts.net/en/institution/san-francisco-museum-of-modern-art-
sfmoma-2379/overview.html SFMoMA (1999)] [http://www.artfacts.net/en/institution/san-francisco-museum-of-modern-
art-sfmoma-2379/overview.html Jennifer Morla solo exhibition at SFMoMA]
and [http://www.dnp.co.jp/gallery/ddd_e/exhibition/d027/index.html DDD Gallery
(1994)] [http://www.dnp.co.jp/gallery/ddd_e/exhibition/d027/index.html
Jennifer Morla solo exhibition at DDD Gallery, Japan] in Japan. Her work
has been displayed in group shows at
[http://www.sfmoma.org/pages/search?query=jennifer+morla
SFMoMA], [http://www.sfmoma.org/pages/search?query=jennifer+morla Jennifer
Morla at SFMoMA] the Grand Palais in Paris, the Brandenburg Art Gallery in
Berlin, the Museum of Art and Design in New York City, the Denver Art Museum and
the in Paris, and the Smithsonian American Art Museum in Washington D.C.

Jennifer Morla served on the National Board of Directors for the AIGA 1997-1999,
was past president of AIGA San Francisco
Chapter [http://aigasf.org/about/people/presidents AIGA San Francisco
Chapter presidents]' (1992), is an [http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/fellow-jennifer-
morla?searchtext=jennifer%20morla AIGA Fellow] [http://www.aiga.org/content.cfm/fellow-jennifer-
morla?searchtext=jennifer%20morla Jennifer Morla, AIGA Fellow Recipient]
(2008), and is on the Accessions Board for Architecture and Design at San
Francisco's Museum of Modern Art (1995âpresent). Since 1992, she has taught
Senior Graphic Design Thesis at California College of the Arts. She lectures
internationally and is a selected member [http://www.a-g-
i.org/?lid=2078&tmpl=images Jennifer Morla's AGI Profile] of [http://a-g-i.org/3583/history/agi-what-is-
it.html Alliance Graphique Internationale] (AGI).

In 1984, she formed [http://www.morladesign.com Morla Design], offering a broad
range of creative services encompassing corporate identity, print collateral,
environmental design, book design, packaging, web and multimedia design. Clients
include The New York Times, Levi Strauss & Co., Apple Computer, Williams-Sonoma,
Inc., Herman Miller, Inc., Stanford University, Gap, Inc. and Luna Textiles. She
has worked extensively with conceptual art venues designing identities, books
and posters for Sculpture Center, Capp Street Project, and New Langton Arts.

As an artist, Jennifer Morlaâs large-scale, encaustic paintings and multi-ton
steel sculpture are shown at K. Kimpton Gallery in San Francisco.
categories: Massachusetts College of Art and Design alumni
